Protecting our elections is critical to ensuring that every American’s vote counts. Now that #SCOTUS has ruled against adding the citizenship question to the #2020Census, we must do all we can to make sure everyone in our community is counted and that their voices are heard.

We need to work with our allies on a long term strategy to ease tensions and prevent further hostilities in Iran. I am co-sponsoring a resolution to reassert Congress’ role in determining when or if we take retaliatory action. Cooler heads and common sense must prevail.

June is PRIDE month and I am proud to co-sponsor the Global Respect Act. LGBTQ people around the world continue to face harassment, violence and bigotry around the world, and that's simply not acceptable.  #Pride2019 #EqualityForAll pic.twitter.com/gxM7cotOCg

The UN Refugee Agncy estimates half the world’s refugees are children, a reminder of how much we must still do. I'm proud to join my colleagues to recognize #WorldRefugeeDay by cosponsoring H.Res. 444, reaffirming U.S. commitment to protect refugees. #StandWithRefugees pic.twitter.com/KUU7AWVqwg

Meet Agnes Moore and Marian Sousa. During WWII, hundreds of thousands of women joined the workforce. Known as ‘Rosie the Riveter’, these women, such as Agnes (a welder) and Marian (a draftsman), filled the empty jobs left behind as our men went off to battle. pic.twitter.com/2fPQP93MQG

Talking with Ray Lambert - a medic who was one of the first US troops to land on the beaches of Normandy. Injured himself on that fateful day, he managed to save 15 men.  You can read more about his story here:   https://www.npr.org/2019/06/05/730013091/d-day-veteran-remembers-deadly-battle … pic.twitter.com/lY2C3C5IXb
Flying over the beautifully green French countryside. #DDay DDay75 pic.twitter.com/iiEIS8HDet

Heading this morning to the beaches of Normandy to mark the 75th anniversary of the Allied D-Day invasion.
